question: Determine the shape factor for the cross section of the H-beam. <image 1>
description:
The image depicts a cross-sectional view of an H-beam, which is a type of structural steel beam commonly used in construction. The dimensions provided in the image are as follows:

- The overall height of the beam is 200 mm.
- The width of the flanges (the horizontal parts at the top and bottom) is also 200 mm.
- The thickness of the flanges is 20 mm.
- The web (the vertical part connecting the flanges) has a thickness of 20 mm.

The shape factor for the cross section of the H-beam can be determined using these dimensions. The options given are:
A. 1.17
B. 1.57
C. 0.87

Based on the provided dimensions and typical calculations for H-beams, the correct answer is:

B. 1.57
